dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, we've been talking a lot about, uh, climate change and environmental issues, but guess what's a massive contributor that we don't always, like, immediately think about? Our food system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we've been talking a lot about, uh, climate change and environmental issues, but guess what's a massive contributor that we don't always, like, immediately think about? Our food system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The way we produce and consume this food, meanwhile, damages Earths life-support system. It accounts for about one-quarter of greenhouse-gas emissions and is the biggest cause of land-use change, biodiversity loss, and water extraction, leaving rivers dried out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, the way we produce and consume food right now, it's actually pretty damaging to Earth's entire life-support system. It's, um, a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, the way we produce and consume food right now, it's actually pretty damaging to Earth's entire life-support system. It's, um, a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The way we produce and consume this food, meanwhile, damages Earths life-support system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! It accounts for, what, about a quarter of greenhouse gas emissions? That's insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! It accounts for, what, about a quarter of greenhouse gas emissions? That's insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It accounts for about one-quarter of greenhouse-gas emissions and is the biggest cause of land-use change, biodiversity loss, and water extraction, leaving rivers dried out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it's the biggest cause of land-use change, biodiversity loss, even, like, rivers drying up from water extraction. It's a lot to unpack.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it's the biggest cause of land-use change, biodiversity loss, even, like, rivers drying up from water extraction. It's a lot to unpack.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It accounts for about one-quarter of greenhouse-gas emissions and is the biggest cause of land-use change, biodiversity loss, and water extraction, leaving rivers dried out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And we all want to eat healthier, right? There are so many books on healthy eating and weight loss. But few countries are actually taking action to improve diets *and* preserve the environment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And we all want to eat healthier, right? There are so many books on healthy eating and weight loss. But few countries are actually taking action to improve diets and preserve the environment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sheer volume of books on healthy eating and weight loss suggests that people want to move to healthier diets. But few countries are taking action to improve diets and preserve the environment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's the big question, isn't it? Can we sustainably provide a healthy diet to a global population that's projected to hit ten billion by 2050? It feels, uh, daunting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the big question, isn't it? Can we sustainably provide a healthy diet to a global population that's projected to hit ten billion by twenty fifty? It feels, uh, daunting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big question is whether we can sustainably provide a healthy diet to a global population that is projected to reach ten billion by 2050.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's where this EAT-Lancet Commission comes in, right? Like, thirty-seven scientists from sixteen countries, trying to answer that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's where this E A T-Lancet Commission comes in, right? Like, thirty-seven scientists from sixteen countries, trying to answer that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two years ago, the EAT-Lancet Commission, comprising 37 scientists from 16 countries me included set out to provide an answer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they spent two years figuring out what a good diet for a healthy life should contain, and then, like, what that would mean for global food production sustainability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they spent two years figuring out what a good diet for a healthy life should contain, and then, like, what that would mean for global food production sustainability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two years ago, the EAT-Lancet Commission, comprising 37 scientists from 16 countries me included set out to provide an answer. We began by determining what a good diet for a healthy life should contain. We then explored the implications of such a diet for global sustainability of food production in the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And they just published their findings in The Lancet, which, uh, apparently hit a nerve. I read there were over five thousand stories about it in the media already.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they just published their findings in The Lancet, which, uh, apparently hit a nerve. I read there were over five thousand stories about it in the media already.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Commission published its findings in January in the medical journal The Lancet. Our report identifies, for the first time, scientific targets for diets and the global food-production system. With more than 5,000 stories about the report already in the international media, its release clearly has hit a nerve.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And their main conclusion, which is actually pretty hopeful, is that feeding ten billion people on a sustainable planet *is* possible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And their main conclusion, which is actually pretty hopeful, is that feeding ten billion people on a sustainable planet is possible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our main conclusion, supported by reams of peer-reviewed evidence, is that feeding ten billion people on a sustainable planet is possible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But it needs a "transformation" of the food system, right? Like, addressing obesity, improving health, stopping deforestation, cutting emissions, protecting the oceans...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it needs a transformation of the food system, right? Like, addressing obesity, improving health, stopping deforestation, cutting emissions, protecting the oceans...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But doing so will require a transformation of the food system to address obesity, improve health, end forest loss, curb greenhouse-gas emissions, and protect the oceans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. They said there are three big things we need to do. First, halve the amount of food waste by 2050.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. They said there are three big things we need to do. First, halve the amount of food waste by twenty fifty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The world must do three big things in particular. It needs to halve the amount of food waste by 2050.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is huge, right? Think of how much food just gets thrown away!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is huge, right? Think of how much food just gets thrown away!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Second, we need to move to more efficient and sustainable production systems and invest in healthier crops. And third, people need to eat differently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Second, we need to move to more efficient and sustainable production systems and invest in healthier crops. And third, people need to eat differently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It must move to more efficient and sustainable production systems and invest more in healthier crops. And people need to eat more fruit, vegetables, nuts, and legumes and reduce their dairy and red-meat consumption.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: More fruits, vegetables, nuts, and legumes... and reduce our dairy and red-meat consumption. That's a big shift for a lot of people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: More fruits, vegetables, nuts, and legumes... and reduce our dairy and red-meat consumption. That's a big shift for a lot of people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And people need to eat more fruit, vegetables, nuts, and legumes and reduce their dairy and red-meat consumption.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is, but their analysis indicates that moving to such a balanced diet could prevent eleven million premature deaths per year. They call it a "planetary health diet."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is, but their analysis indicates that moving to such a balanced diet could prevent eleven million premature deaths per year. They call it a planetary health diet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our analysis indicates that moving to such a balanced diet could prevent 11 million premature deaths per year. ... To achieve this, the Commission proposes a planetary health diet of 2,500 calories per day for an average global citizen leading an active life.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like, 2,500 calories a day, but super flexible, adaptable to different cultures and cuisines, whether it's Asian, European... kind of like the old Mediterranean diet, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like, two thousand, five hundred calories a day, but super flexible, adaptable to different cultures and cuisines, whether it's Asian, European... kind of like the old Mediterranean diet, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To achieve this, the Commission proposes a planetary health diet of 2,500 calories per day for an average global citizen leading an active life. ... We went to great lengths to stress that this diet is flexible and can be adapted to different cultures and different produce, whether Asian, European, African, or those of the Americas. The common Mediterranean diet of a generation ago, with plenty of fresh vegetables and fruit, has much in common with our planetary health diet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they also stress it's not just about *what* we eat, but *how* we produce it. There's no single path, whether you're a big farm or a small holding.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they also stress it's not just about what we eat, but how we produce it. There's no single path, whether you're a big farm or a small holding.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is important to recognize that shifting to the planetary health diet will not in itself lead to sustainable production. We also need to improve how we produce what we eat. There is no single path to sustainable production. Whether food producers operate large businesses, intensive farms, smallholdings, or organic farms, all can support the dietary and sustainability transition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But, um, some industry groups are pushing back, saying meat and dairy are an important part of a nutritious diet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, um, some industry groups are pushing back, saying meat and dairy are an important part of a nutritious diet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, several industry groups and other commentators have argued that meat and dairy are an important part of a nutritious diet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They *can* be, sure, but that part should be much smaller than it is today. And frankly, diets have changed dramatically in recent decades globally. It's feasible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They can be, sure, but that part should be much smaller than it is today. And frankly, diets have changed dramatically in recent decades globally. It's feasible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While I agree that they can be part of a healthy diet, that part should be much smaller than it is today. ... Globally, however, we can trace how diets have changed dramatically in recent decades.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the goal now is to start a real discussion among all stakeholders, from farmers to consumers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the goal now is to start a real discussion among all stakeholders, from farmers to consumers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, we want the report to start a discussion among all stakeholders from farmers to consumers about what we will be eating, and how we produce it, ten, 20, and 30 years from now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So our food system can benefit our health and, uh, the health of the planet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So our food system can benefit our health and, uh, the health of the planet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If we can do that, our food system can benefit, rather than harm, our own health and that of the planet.
